matrix Struct Reference

Detailed Description

Implementation of a 2D-matrix.

A matrix A is a set of values grouped as a table arranged by rows and columns: a matrix m x n (rows x columns) is

where aij are the elements of A (i = 1..m, j = 1..n) Vectors are matrices with only one row or column: they only need one subindex.

Sometimes it may be convenient to consider special rows or columns:

Ri(A) -- row i.

Cj(A) -- row j.

Note:
Please, note that all subindexes are offset at one (1)
